meanings.sent1: The students rouped in the library for a group project.
meanings.sent2: The family rouped around the dinner table for a meal.
meanings.sent3: The toys rouped together in the toy chest for a secret meeting.
meanings.sent4: The clouds rouped in the sky, ready to pour down rain.
meanings.sent5: The birds rouped on the tree branches, chirping happily.

meanings.definition: To sell off goods, usually at a reduced price.
meanings.sent1: The store rouped their old inventory to make space for new products.
meanings.sent2: During the clearance sale, the shop rouped many items at discounted prices.
meanings.sent3: The farmer decided to roup his surplus crops to the neighbors at a bargain.
meanings.sent4: The online auction site allowed users to roup their items to the highest bidder.
meanings.sent5: The charity event rouped donations from the community to support a cause.

meanings.sent1: The painter carefully rouped the old wallpaper from the wall.
meanings.sent2: The snake began to roup its old skin as it prepared to shed.
meanings.sent3: The chef needed to roup the outer layer of the onion for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The wind started to roup the leaves from the trees in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: The waves rouped the sand from the shore, revealing hidden treasures.
